data.Description: Google confirms no option to block content from Discover, unlike News, highlighting limitations in crawling control.

data.Title: Google Says Having Massive Disavow Lists & Removing Them Should Not Worry You
data.Description: John Mueller from Google was asked if you should worry that massive link disavow lists can hurt you negatively and also if you remove the list that it might also hurt you.  John said you should not be worried at all, when he was asked how worried should you be, he said "zero."

data.Title: Schema.org Gets Design Upgrade
data.Description: Schema.org has a new design, it seems like the design went live this week. The Schema.org validator also looks fresh and new. It is unclear if there were any other changes made, outside of the design update.

data.Title: Google To Have More Creator Type Meetings
data.Description: Brandon Saltalamacchia, the founder of Retro Dodo, covered his meeting he had with Danny Sullivan at Google - he covered it under the title A Brief Meeting With Google After The Apocalypse. Danny Sullivan said later that this was the second time he recently had such a meeting and he is working on setting up the third one soon.

data.Title: Bing's index now also powers ChatGPT (and thus, soon Apple's Siri), Meta AI, LinkedIn AI and Microsoft Copilot.
data.Description: I can't believe I am about to write this but... the Bing index is crucial in the future of SEO. Why? It's not about Bing the search engine. Bing's index now also powers ChatGPT (and thus, soon Apple's Siri), Meta AI, LinkedIn AI and Microsoft Copilot.

data.Title: Thrasio Slims Down in Comeback Attempt
data.Description: The Amazon aggregator averaged one acquisition per week during the pandemic. Then it filed for bankruptcy.

data.Title: Ad execs sound the alarm over Google's risky Privacy Sandbox terms
data.Description: Google's Privacy Sandbox outage sparks contractual concerns since its terms of service leave users footing the bill even when it doesn't work.

data.Title: Retail media has become a full-funnel play for media agencies
data.Description: Holding companies as well as independents have stepped up their resource-building around retail media and the broader catch-all of commerce media — although there’s a lack of standardization around the terminology used in the space.

data.Title: Confessions of a DTC investor on the difficulty of dealing with the 'increasingly common' founder-influencer
data.Description: In the latest edition of our Confessions series, in which we trade anonymity for candor, we hear from a DTC investor on what it’s like to work with founder-influencers and why it’s a difficult balance to navigate.

data.Title: 'Everything is AI now': Amid AI boom, agencies navigate data security, stability and fairness
data.Description: AI tools and platforms, whether they're built on generative AI or glorified machine learning, have flooded the marketplace. In response, agencies are wading through them via sandboxes, internal AI task forces and client contracts.

data.Title: Clients want agencies to deliver industry expertise, agility and empathy, new research finds
data.Description: With a number of businesses run by millennials and Gen Z, marketers are seeking not just a vendor when working with agencies – but a true collaborator. This seems to be especially true in the case of B2B marketing when they are on both the consumer and buying sides.

data.Title: Why sustainability is 'not a priority' for marketers right now
data.Description: Anecdotally, there have been noticeably fewer requests from marketers on ways to market sustainability efforts in recent months, according to agency execs, who say that requests had been commonplace in the late 2010s and early 2020s.

data.Title: Why longer videos are becoming more commonplace on YouTube
data.Description: Short-form videos may have surged in popularity over the past several years, but the long-form video format is on the comeback trail.

data.Title: Tubi hits growth spurt, but isn't part of the streaming wars, CMO Nicole Parlapiano says
data.Description: On the latest episode of the Digiday Podcast, Tubi CMO Nicole Parlapiano shares her perspective on the so-called streaming wars, pitching Tubi’s multicultural viewers and the streaming platform’s growth track.

data.Title: Why angel investor Matthew Ball still believes in the metaverse
data.Description: Matthew Ball’s 2022 book “The Metaverse: And How It Will Revolutionize Everything” was a national bestseller in the U.S. and U.K. On July 23, he plans to publish the second edition of the book.

data.Title: Platforms struggle with misinformation and exploitation amid Trump assassination attempt
data.Description: The assassination attempt on former President Donald Trump starkly highlights the razor-thin line between profit and ethics that platforms are precariously tightrope-walking as the presidential race heats up.
